 All functionality of the content is operable through a keyboard interface
without requiring specific timings for individual keystrokes, except where the
underlying function requires input that depends on the path of the user's
movement and not just the endpoints. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
KEYBOARD ACCESSIBLE
KEYBOARD(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

All functionality of the content is operable through a keyboard interface
without requiring specific timings for individual keystrokes, except where the
underlying function requires input that depends on the path of the user's
movement and not just the endpoints. 

These websites...

Make all functionality available from a keyboard.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Example 2: A drag and Drop Feature. 

An application that uses drag and drop also supports "cut" and "paste" or form
controls to move objects. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard.html#examples] Web Content
Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium Recommendation 27
February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/, Latest version at
https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
